FareStructureElement.Name: Available zones
FareStructureElement.Description: Trip may start in a city zone and continue to distance section

FareStructureElement.Name: Available Intervals
FareStructureElement.Description:
How are West of England Zone single fares calculated? In the West of England Zone single fares are worked out based on the route distance you are travelling. Distances are calculated using fare stage sections rather than individual bus stops, with each section being approximately one mile long*. If you travel in 1-3 mile long sections it'll be 2.50, 3-6 mile long sections will be 3.50 and so on.
Here is an example route and some of the fares along it: Emersons Green, Sainsbury's to Long Close would be 2.50 as you are travelling in three sections (numbers 1, 2 and 3, Long Close is classed as section 3 in this example as it's where you are getting off the bus). Long Close to Narroways Road would be 3.50 as you are travelling in four sections (4, 5, 6, 7, Long Close is counted as section 4 in this example as it's your boarding point). Blackberry Hospital to Downend, The Leap would be 3.50 as you are travelling in four sections (5, 4, 3, 2).

FareStructureElement.Name: Overall journey steps
FareStructureElement.Description: Journey is potentially made up of two steps

FareStructureElementInSequence.Name: Optional firstt leg in inner zone
FareStructureElementInSequence.Description: If a journey begins within a flat fare zone but travels beyond the border of that zone, the fare will be calculated as follows: Flat fare to the border of the zone, then rounded up to 2.50, 3.50, 4.50 or 5.50 depending on the distance travelled thereafter.

PreassignedFareProduct.Name: West of England Distance based (section fare) trip
PreassignedFareProduct.Description: The cost of single tickets within the West of England will be based on the route distance you travel, with five new single fares available:

ValidableElement.Name: Unlimited rides available for specifed periods

SalesOfferPackage.Name: First West of England Distance Bsed Trip Fare - p-ticket
First West of England Distance Based Trip Fare - m-ticket
SalesOfferPackage.Description:
Single trip on stage fare How do mTickets work? Once a ticket is purchased and downloaded, it will appear in the 'purchased' section of the Ticket Wallet in your app. Tickets in this section are listed from the oldest at the top to the newest at the bottom.
When you want to use a ticket, select the one you want and then select 'Activate Now'. You'll then be informed of how long the ticket will be active for, before confirming that you want to want to activate this ticket. We would advise reading this carefully to avoid activating unwanted tickets. Once activated, the app will generate a moving ticket image on your phone's screen and a QR code. This will stay active for the remainder of the ticket's validity and will include the time and a four letter 'word of the day'. You'll need to scan the QR when you board the bus or show the ticket to the driver.

DistributionAssignment.Name: Mobile app
DistributionAssignment.Description: Pay for ticket online with mobile app

Transferability.Name: Child tickets
Transferability.Description: Customers can send tickets to a child or young person by using the sharing feature on child and young person tickets. As it stands, this function is only available for child tickets - adult tickets cannot be shared. The instructions below tell you all you need to know about sharing a ticket once it has been purchased:

FareFrame.Name: First West of England ^amp; Bristol common parameters

FareDemandFactor.Name: Off peak hours
FareDemandFactor.Description: First Day Group tickets allow up to 5 people, unlimited travel all day until 4.29am the following day in your chosen area. Tickets can be bought after 9.30am Monday to Friday and all day Saturdays, Sundays and Public Holidays.

Tariff.Name: First photo id
Tariff.Description: Children aged 5-15 get up to 50% OFF all single, day and season tickets Young people aged 16-21 and students get up to 30% OFF all singles, day and season tickets (excluding West of England Plus)
Tariff.OperatorRef: First Bristol, Bath and the West nocn:136361

UserProfile.Name: Child
UserProfile.Description: Children aged 5-15 are entitled to a 50% discount on all tickets across the West of England. We would advise all older children to get a (free) First Photo ID pass as proof of age. If the driver can't be sure how old they are, and they are not able to produce one of these, they may be required to pay a full adult fare, so it's in their interests to have one. An application form can be found on page 23.

UserProfile.Name: Student
UserProfile.Description: 30PCT discount for 16-21 year olds and students. Young people (16-21) and students (of any age if in full time education) can get a 30% discount on all tickets if they have a First Photo ID pass or their student photo ID.

CompanionProfile.Name: Infant
CompanionProfile.Description: Unlimited children under five can travel for free with each fare-paying adult/student/16-21 year old or concessionary pass holder.

UserProfile.Name: Infant
UserProfile.Description: Unlimited children under five can travel for free with each fare-paying adult/student/16-21 year old or concessionary pass holder.

SaleDiscountRight.Name: Photo id
SaleDiscountRight.Description: Please complete the form if you are sending the application by post or alternatively visit your local First travel shop. You will need to include: The completed form A passport sized photo of the pass holder Proof of age (birth certificate or passport ) or proof of student status (a valid NUS/student card). Photocopies are accepted DO NOT send originals. Please send all the above to: Photo ID Applications, First, Enterprise House, Easton Road, Bristol BS5 0DZ or email your details to ticketssww@firstgroup

DistributionChannel.Name: First travel shop
DistributionChannel.Description: Most of our tickets are available from our First Travel Shops in the following locations. At these shops you can also collect timetables and ask our staff any questions you may have about the local bus services.
